title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 20 july [1870]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 20 July [1870]
text: 1870July 20 My dear Walti got your letter yesterday but the paper you spoke of i haventhaven't received yet i dontdon't seem to have much to write walterWalter as i dontdon't hear from any of our family i haventhaven't had any word from st louisSt. Louis in a very long time i sent a letter last week but have got no answer i have hansHan's box ready and am waiting for an express man the one i left the order to come last tuesdayTuesday did not come it was westcotsWestcott's too but he didentdidn't come i think its likely this is the last box i shall ever get up it has worrieworried me enoughfenough) the hot weather and all together i think it worries me more than it does them good i have sent her a picture framed and yoursyour's waltWalt as you are coming home so soon i wontwon't send it) the war news seems to be all the rage here i hope it will take the feniansFenians and roughfsroughs off that will doodo some gd i think the paper will come to day waltWalt ice is very scarce and high i haventhaven't had much you dontdon't say any thing about your thumb waltWalt i hope its well Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 20 July [1870]
